headline: Abercrombie & Fitch, Lululemon: Takeaways from holiday updates
summary: Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF) shares plummeted 17% on Monday after the retailer said it expected sales growth of about 5% in the holiday quarter, which was in the middle of the range it had forecasted.  Lululemon (LULU) shares rose about 5% after it said it expects its fourth quarter earnings and sales "to be toward the high end of the previously guided ranges." Fitch Ratings senior director David Silverman shares his takeaways on the updates from those companies and American Eagle (AEO). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Specialty Retail Holiday Results Get Mixed Reaction on Wall Street
summary: Urban Outfitters and AEO saw stock losses after holiday sales gains, while Lululemon inched up on a weaker performance.

headline: Abercrombie, Urban Outfitters Have Strong Year-End Sales. Investors Aren’t Sold.
summary: Abercrombie and Urban Outfitters are continuing to record strong sales despite overall weak consumer sentiment, but the stocks of the teen retailers are falling after they missed Wall Street’s expectations.

headline: Lululemon Signals a Better Q4 Finish
summary: Holiday strength lifts outlook despite U.S. softness

headline: Is lululemon's Guest Experience Revamp Improving Store Traffic?
summary: LULU's guest experience revamp, from product activation to new store formats, is starting to lift store traffic and engagement despite U.S. pressures.

headline: Lululemon Rises on Strong Q4 2025 Outlook Despite Leadership Turmoil
summary: Athletic apparel maker sees results near top of guidance range, helped by holiday sales.

headline: Oversold Consumer Stocks Are Opportunities

headline: Lululemon lifts Q4 revenue and profit outlook ahead of ICR Conference
summary: Investing.com -- Lululemon has raised its fourth-quarter revenue and earnings expectations, saying strong holiday trading has put the athleisure retailer on track to hit the upper end of its previously guided ranges.

headline: Lululemon Sees Quarterly Profit at High End After Strong Holiday Sales
summary: Lululemon Athletica said it expects fourth-quarter profit and revenue to come in at the high end of its previously issued forecasts, citing a strong holiday season.

headline: Lululemon Gets a Holiday Boost. It Sees Fourth-Quarter Profit at High End of Guidance.
summary: Lululemon Athletica  stock traded flat Monday after the company updated its fiscal fourth-quarter guidance to reflect a strong holiday season.  The retailer now expects net revenue and earnings per share for the quarter ending Feb. 1, to be at the high end of the previously forecast ranges of $3.5 billion to $3.585 billion and $4.66 to $4.76, respectively.  “Based on our performance over the holiday period, we expect to achieve the higher end of our previously communicated fourth quarter net revenue and EPS guidance,” said Meghan Frank, the company’s chief financial officer.

headline: lululemon athletica inc. Updates Revenue and Earnings Expectations for the Fourth Quarter Ahead of the ICR Conference
summary: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, January 12, 2026--lululemon athletica inc. (NASDAQ:LULU) today announced that the Company now expects net revenue and diluted earnings per share for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025 to be toward the high end of the previously guided ranges of $3.500 billion to $3.585 billion and $4.66 to $4.76, respectively.

headline: Ho-hum holiday: Retail's early results show modest growth in critical shopping season
summary: The 2025 holiday season was solid for some retailers as they posted modest growth, but results failed to blow away expectations.
